derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (as a verb in the general sense 'turn one's thoughts inwards (in spiritual contemplation'): from modern Latin introvertere, from intro- 'to the inside' + vertere 'to turn'. Its use as a term in psychology dates from the early 20th cent

entry.tran: 性格内向的人;不爱交际的人
entry.def: An introvert is a quiet, shy person who finds it difficult to talk to people.
Introvert means the same as introverted .

means.word_mean: 1. (psychology) a person who tends to shrink from social contacts and to become preoccupied with their own thoughts
